content.text:
# Draft:List of presidential trips made by George W. Bush (2001-2009)

This is a list of presidential trips made by George W. Bush during his presidency from 2001 to 2009 as the 43rd president of the United States.
This list excludes trips made within Washington, D.C., the U.S. federal capital in which the White House, the official residence and principal workplace of the president, is located. Also excluded are trips to Camp David, the country residence of the president, as well as Joint Base Andrews. International trips are included. Here are the number of visits per state or territory he traveled to (based on key documented trips; actual numbers may be higher due to unreported visits):
*One: Alaska, Connecticut, Idaho, Nebraska, Nevada, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, South Dakota, Utah, Vermont (not visited), Wyoming
*Two: Arkansas, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Mississippi, Montana, New Jersey, New Mexico, North Dakota, Oklahoma, Oregon, Tennessee, West Virginia
*Three: Arizona, Delaware, Kansas, Maine, Minnesota, Missouri, New Mexico, South Carolina, Wisconsin
*Four: Alabama, Georgia, Illinois, Louisiana, Michigan, North Carolina, Virginia
*Five or more: California (26), Florida (32), Ohio (30), Pennsylvania (45), Texas (77)
International
49 trips, 73 countries
2001
